name: Introduction to Religious Studies
description: This course provides an introduction to the academic study of religion. It explores ways of understanding the nature and role of religion in human culture and considers the methods used to study religious beliefs, practices, and texts.

name: History of Religion
description: This course surveys the history of religion from antiquity to the present. It covers major religious traditions and movements, examines the relationship between religion and politics, and explores the changing role of religion in society.

name: History of Christianity
description: This course examines the history of Christianity from its beginnings in the first century to the present. It explores the development of Christianity in the Roman Empire, the medieval period, and the modern era.

name: History of Judaism
description: This course provides an overview of the history of Judaism from ancient times to the present. It examines the history of Jewish religious thought, practice, and culture, and explores the history of Jewish-Christian relations.

name: History of Islam
description: This course surveys the history of the Islamic tradition from its origins in the seventh century to the present. It examines the development of Islamic thought, practice, and culture, and explores the history of Muslim-Christian relations.
